noun.description: The occurrence, rate, or frequency of a disease, crime, or something else undesirable.
The intersection of a line, or something moving in a straight line, such as a beam of light, with a surface.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a casual or subordinate event): from Old French, or from medieval Latin incidentia, from Latin incidere fall upon, happen to (see incident). incidence (sense 1) dates from the early 19th century.
